results.headline: Review: ‘The Outrageous Sophie Tucker’ Recalls a Jazz Powerhouse
results.summary_short: This documentary details the life and career of Tucker, a hobnobbing 20th-century jazz singer known for her big voice.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Outrageous Sophie Tucker

results.headline: Review: ‘Samba,’ About the Travails of an Illegal Immigrant in France
results.summary_short: The makers of the hit “The Intouchables” tell the story of an African without papers (Omar Sy) and the caseworker (Charlotte Gainsbourg) who falls for him.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Samba

results.headline: Review: ‘Phoenix’ Shows Rebirth and a Ruse in Postwar Germany
results.summary_short: Never less than intriguing, coolly intelligent and flawlessly paced, “Phoenix” often feels trapped in the logic of its conceit.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Phoenix

results.headline: Review: ‘Paper Towns’ Tries to Fold Significance Into the Everyday
results.summary_short: A story about boy meets girl, girl forgets boy, girl returns to boy, based on a book by John Green, author of “The Fault in Our Stars.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Paper Towns

results.headline: Review: ‘Lucky Stiff,’ Still Farcical, Returns as a Movie
results.summary_short: An update of the play that opened Off Broadway in 1988, this film is about a shoe salesman who learns that an uncle he never met has left him a large inheritance.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lucky Stiff

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Vatican Tapes,’ the Sinister Stare of Possession
results.summary_short: Olivia Taylor Dudley is unnerving in her portrayal of a young woman who needs an exorcism.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Vatican Tapes

results.headline: Review: In ‘Southpaw,’ Jake Gyllenhaal Tries to Box His Way Back From Tragedy
results.summary_short: Antoine Fuqua’s ode to boxing also stars Forest Whitaker as a tenacious trainer and Rachel McAdams as a loving tough-cookie wife.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Southpaw

results.headline: Review: In ‘Pixels,’ Attack of the Retro Video Games
results.summary_short: Adam Sandler fights Pac-Man (yes, that beloved character is a “bad guy”) to save the country.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Pixels

results.headline: Review: ‘Frank the Bastard,’ a Trip Back to Old Crimes at the Commune
results.summary_short: Hidden and traumatic histories and multiple intrigues and motivations populate this diffuse melodrama, set in a rustic Maine town.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Frank the Bastard

results.headline: Review: ‘Dark Was the Night’ Confronts a Demon in the Woods
results.summary_short: The director Jack Heller’s horror film draws its talent from television: Kevin Durand, Lukas Haas and Bianca Kajlich.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dark Was the Night

results.headline: Review: ‘Big Significant Things’ Compares Landmarks in Life and on the Road
results.summary_short: In this film, Harry Lloyd plays a character who runs from commitment in search of highway novelties.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Big Significant Things

results.headline: Review: ‘Trainwreck’ Delivers the Full Amy Schumer Experience
results.summary_short: The movie, directed by Judd Apatow from Ms. Schumer’s script, is a romantic comedy packed with pop-cultural references and edged with social critique.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Trainwreck

results.headline: Review: ‘The Stanford Prison Experiment’ Revisits the Psychology of Power and Abuse
results.summary_short: The film is about the notorious 1971 psychological study in which students were recruited to play either guards or inmates in a make-believe prison.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Stanford Prison Experiment

results.headline: Review: In ‘A Hard Day,’ Looney Tunes Meets Cops, Corpses and Crime
results.summary_short: The protagonist in Kim Seong-hun’s fast-paced cop movie is distressed by his mother’s death, ominous colleagues, a hectoring sister and a body in the trunk.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Hard Day

results.headline: Review: ‘Alleluia’ Follows Partners in Crime, but Not Necessarily in Love
results.summary_short: A reimagining of the 1970 classic “The Honeymoon Killers,” this Belgian film begins as an erotic thriller and morphs into a horror movie.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Alleluia

results.headline: Review: Woody Allen’s ‘Irrational Man’ Explores Life’s Randomness
results.summary_short: Joaquin Phoenix stars as a college philosophy professor who capriciously decides to commit a crime.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Irrational Man

results.headline: Review: ‘The Look of Silence’ Confronts Individuals and Ideology of Indonesian Massacre
results.summary_short: This documentary by the American filmmaker Joshua Oppenheimer, like its companion film, “The Act of Killing,” examines the mass killings that began in the country in 1965.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Look of Silence

results.headline: Review: Steak (R)evolution Travels the World to Find the Best Beef
results.summary_short: This documentary is not about the meat of the backyard-barbecue variety.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Twinsters,’ Separated-at-Birth Twins Tell Their Own Story
results.summary_short: This film, which one of the twins helped direct, uses Facebook and Skype communication as a narrative device.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Twinsters

results.headline: Review: In ‘Northern Limit Line,’ the Koreas Do Battle
results.summary_short: The writer and director Kim Hak-soon seeks to dramatize a real 2002 clash near a disputed maritime border.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Northern Limit Line
